captions.text:
They have speedy bodies
and particularly small faces.

'Cheetah' is derived
from a Hindi word, cītā,
which means 'the spotted one.'

Because of their black tear marks,
some people say they look sad.
But the tear marks are a gift from God.
It reduces the glare,

which helps them see their prey
clearly from far away.

This lets the cheetah hunt during the day
unlike most other nocturnal hunters.

When the cheetah hunts,
its only strategy is speed.

The cheetah can quickly change direction
or stop while running.

The cheetah's long tail
helps keep its balance.

The cheetah trips its prey
as it gets close.
Chasing, tripping, and then eating.
This is their typical hunting method.
There is no safe place in the prairie.
All herbivores are potential prey.

Cheetahs usually hunt small animals
that are easily captured.

Their chances of hunting are better
as they close in on their prey.

The babies are easier targets
than their mothers.

The baby gazelle struggles to live
even when there is no hope left.

But there is no use discussing
good and evil in this place.

Hunting is directly related
to survival for the cheetah.
A crossroad of joy and sorrow.
The cheetah will be fed,

but the mother gazelle
has lost her baby.

Do the herbivores have
no defense strategies?

No two zebras are alike
just like human fingerprints.

Therefore,
zebras can identify their family.

Also, when together, it causes
an optical illusion for the hunter.

This makes it hard for the hunter
to choose a target.

Another animal that seeks safety
in herds is the gnu.

They have small eyes and horns
like water buffalo.
They also have beards and manes.

African myths say that
after the gods made all the creatures,

they used the leftovers
to create the gnu.

January is the month of new births
for the gnu.
There are about 20,000 births daily.

If a hunter were to come now,
they would be defenseless.

The mothers give birth at the same time
to reduce the possibility
that they will be chosen as prey.

The gnu is the only animal
that gives birth as a group.

Even the cheetah has growing pains
until it is fully grown.

They often choose the wrong target
and fail to hunt as young cheetahs.

The young cheetah's humiliation
does not end here.

Their claws are sharp,
but they don't bend.

Their claws become useless
if they encounter thick-skinned warthogs.

The warthog might
even attack the cheetah.

Hunting isn't always easy
for the adults, either.

Their fastest speed is
120km per hour.

Even at this speed,
their success rate is 40%.
They fail 6 out of 10 times.

But their success in hunting gazelles
is surprisingly close to 70%.

The cheetah has weak teeth
in exchange for speed,

so it's hard for them
to kill their prey instantly.

It's a harsh death
for the baby gazelle.

But hunting is the cheetah's
natural way of survival.

The cheetah is one of the fastest
disappearing predators in Africa.

Almost 90% of cheetahs die
within 6 months of birth.

And incestuous mating is
threatening the future of cheetahs.
Survival is not easy for hunters, either.

title: Incredible speed cheetah - Hunters-Wildlife Predators, #02, 치타, 쾌속 질주를 이용하라
